intro: [WRONG START] Astelea spicata, commonly known as the spike aster, is a perennial plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant features upright, cylindrical stems that bear dense clusters of small, spike-like flowers. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that are typically dark green. Astelia spicata is often found in damp, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands.
